hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via Volatility Expansion with Strong Breadth
hypothesis_content.statement: From a NEUTRAL regime, if the 10-day average of BTC daily returns is between -0.5% and +0.5% (tight range) and then BTC rallies >7% on a single day with >80% of top 50 altcoins (by market cap) also rallying >5%, this signals a volatility expansion breakout with broad participation, triggering a transition to a BULL regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes consolidate energy. A high-magnitude move alone can be a false breakout. However, when accompanied by extremely strong market breadth, it indicates coordinated buying across asset classes, suggesting a fundamental or macro-driven shift in capital allocation, not just technical speculation. This is characteristic of a true regime transition.
entry_conditions: BTC rallies >7% in a single day
>80% of top 50 altcoins rally >5% on the same day (breadth confirmation)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Position closed when regime classification shifts to BULL
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price gives back >75% of the breakout day's gains within 3 days (failed breakout)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such high-breadth breakouts fail to establish a BULL regime, with price retracing back into the prior range and volatility collapsing within one week.
